facelet-taglib.description: The Liferay Faces Alloy facelet component tags with the alloy: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns an escaped representation of the specified client ID.
Returns the client ID associated with the specified expression.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: Button is a UIOutput component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is button. Since it extends HtmlOutcomeTargetButton it supports all the features of h:button. The component does not need to be a child of h:form since the outcome attribute is designed to navigate via HTTP GET.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not the component should automatically recieve focus on the initial page load.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the client window param will not be inlcuded on the navigation URL. Note: the ClientWindow feature is disabled by default, so this attribute will have no effect unless ClientWindow is enabled.
attribute.name: disableClientWindow

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A fragment to be appended to the navigation URL.
attribute.name: fragment

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies the URL of an image.
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: When this flag is true, view parameters (specified via f:viewParam tags) will be included on the navigation URL
attribute.name: includeViewParams

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: A string which potentially matches the value of from-outcome key in a navigation-case.
attribute.name: outcome

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The type of the button: button (default), submit, or reset.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: The value of this component.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Column is a UIColumn component that renders a div with CSS class name span# (for example: span1 or span5).

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The width that the column will be offset by as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as offset# (for example if offset="4", the CSS class rendered will be offset4). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset. Please consider using offsetWidth.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: The width that the column will be offset by as a percent. This value selects the offset via the formula offset = (offsetWidth/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset.
attribute.name: offsetWidth

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The width of this column as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as span# (for example if span="4", the CSS class rendered will be span4). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number. Please consider using width.
attribute.name: span

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The width of the column as a percent. This value selects the span number via the formula span = (width/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: CommandButton is a UICommand component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is submit. Since it extends HtmlCommandButton it supports all the features of h:commandButton. The component must be a child of h:form in order to trigger the action or actionListener.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return an Object, and take no arguments. The toString() method of the returned object is used to determine where to navigate (if at all) after the action has been performed.
attribute.name: action

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return void, and take either no arguments or one ActionEvent argument.
attribute.name: actionListener

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not the component should automatically recieve focus on the initial page load.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies the URL of an image.
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when the user selects this component.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: When true, this causes an attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly", and prevents the user from changing the value of this component.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The type of the button: button, submit (default), or reset.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: The value of this component.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Icon is a component that renders a span which contains an icon specified by the name attribute.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The icon which this component will render. A list of valid icons can be found at Bootstrap Base CSS. Note: icon names must be specified without the icon- prefix.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: InputDate is a UIInput component that renders a textbox and a popup a calendar with selectable dates. The component attepts to automatically convert the submitted value to a Date via a built in DateTimeConverter.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether autocomplete is turned on or off for the rendered HTML element. Valid values include on (default) and off.
attribute.name: autocomplete

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: The format of the date that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: datePattern

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Used to determine the format fo the date unless the datePattern is specified. The locale of the pickDate.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: The maximum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: maximumDate

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the maximum length of characters allowed in the element.
attribute.name: maxlength

attribute.description: The minimum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: minimumDate

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when the user selects this component.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: The number of month panes shown in the popup calendar. Valid values are 1 (the default), 2, and 3.
attribute.name: panes

attribute.description: When true, this causes an attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly", and prevents the user from changing the value of this component.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: Specifies which event will pop up the calendar. Valid values are focus (the default), button, and both.
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the visual length of the element.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the calendar popup. When running in Liferay Portal, the value of Liferay.zIndex.TOOLTIP is the default.
attribute.name: zIndex

tag.description: InputSourceCode is an input component that renders a field for editing source code text.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The height of ACE Editor.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Determine if the active line of code will be highlighted or not.
attribute.name: highlightActiveLine

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Correspond to the language being typed.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: Determine if the code will be editable or not.
attribute.name: readOnly

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: Determine if print margin will be visible or not.
attribute.name: showPrintMargin

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: The indentation size of tab key.
attribute.name: tabSize

attribute.description: Determine if the tab key will act as space characters or tab characters.
attribute.name: useSoftTabs

attribute.description: Determine if the line will break when it reaches the end of the line.
attribute.name: useWrapMode

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.
attribute.name: widgetRender

attribute.description: The width of ACE Editor.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

tag.description: CharCounter is an OutputText component that displays the number of allowed characters remaining for a given text input, and limits the number of characters allowed in the input. Renders as HtmlOutputText renders, so this tag will optionally render a span when i18n or style attributes used.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: counter

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When false, markup will not be escaped. This is true by default.
attribute.name: escape

attribute.description: The id of the text input node which is used to calculate the remaining characters. One of either "for" or "input" are required.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Input text node which will have it's number of characters limited by the charCounter. One of either "for" or "input" are required.
attribute.name: input

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Max number of characters the input can have.
attribute.name: maxLength

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onceMaxlengthReached

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onMaxlengthReached

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: PickDate is a UIComponent that renders a popup a calendar with selectable dates.

attribute.description: The active input element that holds the calendar instance.
attribute.name: activeInput

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: The format of the date that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: datePattern

attribute.description: The id of the component that the pickDate will be triggered by. If trigger is specified, this value is unused.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Used to determine the format fo the date unless the datePattern is specified. The locale of the pickDate.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: The maximum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: maximumDate

attribute.description: The minimum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: minimumDate

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Specifies the date selection style. Valid values include single (the default), multiple, or multiple-sticky.
attribute.name: selectionMode

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The fully-qualified id of the element that triggers the calendar popup. Please consider using the for attribute instead.
attribute.name: trigger

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the calendar popup. When running in Liferay Portal, the value of Liferay.zIndex.TOOLTIP is the default.
attribute.name: zIndex

tag.description: Row is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> and is designed to be used in conjunction with alloy:column child component tags.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the element will have the CSS class row-fluid. Otherwise, the element will have the CSS class row. The default value is true.

tag.description: StarRating is a UISelectOne component that renders a set of stars. The user can click on a star to select a rating and click on the same star a second time to de-select a rating. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneRadio, it accepts f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: __DESCRIPTION__
attribute.name: border

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: If true could be reseted (i.e., have no values selected).
attribute.name: canReset

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: CSS classes applied on Rating.
attribute.name: cssClasses

attribute.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.
attribute.name: defaultSelected

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of a disabled selectItems.
attribute.name: disabledClass

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of an enabled selectItems.
attribute.name: enabledClass

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input replace the radio elements and keep the same name.
attribute.name: hiddenInput

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: When true, any child selectItem with a noSelectOption attribute (which is set to true) will be hidden from the user.
attribute.name: hideNoSelectionOption

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.
attribute.name: inputName

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.
attribute.name: labelNode

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: The direction in which the layout of the component should go. The default value is 'lineDirection'.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: widgetRender

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: SelectThumbRating is a UISelectOne component that renders a pair of thumb icons that a user can select to indicate their favor. The user can click on a thumb to select their favor and click on the same thumb a second time to de-select their favor. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneRadio, it accepts f:selectItem or f:selectItems as children.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying a hot key character for the element.
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: __DESCRIPTION__
attribute.name: border

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: canReset

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: CSS classes applied on ThumbRating.
attribute.name: cssClasses

attribute.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.
attribute.name: defaultSelected

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow hover or click, just display selected stars.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of a disabled selectItems.
attribute.name: disabledClass

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of an enabled selectItems.
attribute.name: enabledClass

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input replace the radio elements and keep the same name.
attribute.name: hiddenInput

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: When true, any child selectItem with a noSelectOption attribute (which is set to true) will be hidden from the user.
attribute.name: hideNoSelectionOption

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.

attribute.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.
attribute.name: label

attribute.name: labelNode

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: Stores the index of the selected element.
attribute.name: selectedIndex

attribute.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.
attribute.name: showTitle

attribute.description: Number of Rating elements to be displayed.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: widgetRender

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: Tab is a panel component that renders nested/child tags as content within itself.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: __DESCRIPTION__
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: TabView is an iterator component that renders tabs either statically or dynamically.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: String representing the default type of the children managed by this Widget. Can also supply default type as a constructor reference.
attribute.name: defaultChildType

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if multiple children can be selected at once. Whether or not multiple selection is enabled is always delegated to the value of the multiple attribute of the root widget in the object hierarchy.
attribute.name: multiple

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Determine the orientation of tabs. Can be stacked (vertical) or not (horizontal).
attribute.name: stacked

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Determine the type of tabs.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be intorduced into the el representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: Whether or not to render the widget automatically after init, and optionally, to which parent node.
attribute.name: widgetRender

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.
attribute.name: width
